text: Which of the following equations represents Newton's Second Law of Motion?
An object with a mass of 5 kg is accelerating at 2 m/s². What is the net force acting on it?
Give your answer in Newtons (N) with only the number.
questions.explanation:
Using Newton's Second Law: \( F = ma \)
\( F = 5 \text{ kg} \times 2 \text{ m/s}^2 = 10 \text{ N} \)

text: What is the SI unit of electric current?
A 60W light bulb is connected to a 120V power supply. What is the current flowing through the bulb?
Express your answer in amperes to two decimal places.
questions.explanation:
Using the power formula: \( P = VI \)
\( I = \frac{P}{V} = \frac{60 \text{ W}}{120 \text{ V}} = 0.5 \text{ A} \)

text: Which formula correctly represents the kinetic energy of an object with mass m and velocity v?
